job_title: Marketing and Development Manager in Irvine, CA
pros: Meaningful work. Working for Ecker makes me feel like I am contributing to something bigger than myself, and seeing how our services positively impact individuals in our community is a fulfilling experience. Amazing people. It takes a special kind of person to work in this field, and it shows in their character, work ethic, and commitment to helping others. LOTS of training opportunities. From nonviolent crisis intervention to cultural awareness and everything in between.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of.

pros: Great atmosphere Good location Nice people
cons: Pay is a little low Nothing

review_title: Great job to learn skills as a therapist
pros: Wonderful staff that collaborate together and are in the field to help clients meet their goals to achieve better mental health. Provides all-encompassing care, including crisis, psychiatry, and therapy for clients and all departments work well together. Staff treat each other like a family.
cons: Low pay, long hours, and a large community to serve.

review_title: Great place to work - challenging and rewarding.
job_title: Case Management Supervisor in Elgin, IL

pros: Staff in departments work well together. Segregated when center unites for staff meetings. Calling in sick or taking time off is given.
cons:
Staff turn over is high. 

Upper management and supervisors do not work with or listen to clients. Supervisors are at each other's throats and fighting constantly. Staff feel tension between supervisors and upper management. 

HR dept isn't assisting staff when needed. Staff are fired if speak their mind or if they do not share personal information. In a certain dept, staff are typical fired before 90 days and she pushes religious views onto staff. 

Insurance is paid for by staff. No 401k, short or long term disability. If want, have to buy from outside source. Computers and documenting programs are older models that breakdown frequently or need to walk away let it load.

pros: Excellent work enviromnemnt , supervisors and co-workers.  Very good benefits. Meaningful work with individuals who need the case management, psychiatry, nursing, rehabilitation, therapy, crisis and residential services that are provided by knowledgable and motivated staff.
cons: Funding has declined significantly in the last six years due to state funding reductions to mental health service providers. The organization's budgets are tight and salaries tend to be low, which is typical for non-profit mental health organizations currently.

pros:
Starting off position in the field
Understanding of DSM 5 & operating system
Young Staff!
Basic training but could develop more in depth trainings for young staff members
cons:
Pay very low
Supervisors don't know anything and lie to staff while manipulating employees
Blames government for all issues
Upper Management stomps around and our high strung while using out of date knowledge
Main Building hard to work within the drama filled walls 
Mandated Billing Hours & if do not meet you will be written up or threatened by supervisor

pros: Meaningful work, friendly staff and management.  Competitive salaries and benefits.
cons: State funding cut backs to non-profits during FY 2016 has caused the organization to make some reductions in extremely rich staff benefits.

review_title: Out of date leadership, stale and declining
pros: Long history of helping clients in Elgin
cons: Inadequate & outdated leadership that is random, cliquey and unprofessional

job_title: National Certified Counselor in Elgin, IL
pros: Great PTO. Supervisors are very knowledgable and care genuinely about their staff. Staff are given their own offices.
cons: Pay is not all that great and there aren't any increases in pay given. Government funded which means a lot of paperwork.

pros: Clients are great; you can really tailor your program to be whatever you want (minding you stay within applicable regulations and laws)
cons: High Burnout; EXTREMELY Low Pay; Most clients are satisfied with where they are in life (motivation is tough)

pros: Great benefits, Great people and clients.  Great place to gain experience.
cons: Freezing everyone's salary for 5 + years.  Low, Low, pay. High Turnover.

pros: Senior staff sets a good example of providing valued care and services to clients.

job_title: Residential Case Manager in Elgin, IL
pros: great team of coworkers, great experience, learned a lot
cons: non-profit organization, stressful with huge case load, under paid
